h1: Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, pan-broiled (cooked), drained of excess fat; 1 pound ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, fat drainage, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pound of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~1116 kcal and ~115 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use 90% lean (less fat) vs. 80% lean per 100 g
Add 1 tbsp oil during cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1116 kcal for 80% lean, pan-broiled and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: Roughly 115 g protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—90% lean has ~186 kcal per 100 g vs. 246 for 80% lean.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled). Raw is slightly lower due to water content.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a pound of 80% lean ground beef?
faqs.a: About 70 g total fat, with 27 g saturated.
